noun.description: A hot spring in which water intermittently boils, sending a tall column of water and steam into the air.
A gas-fired water heater through which water flows as it is rapidly heated.

verb.description: (especially of water or steam) gush or burst out with great force.

origin: Late 18th century: from Icelandic Geysir, the name of a particular spring in Iceland; related to geysa to gush.
